intro: Lindsaea repens var. cheilosora, commonly known as the creeping lindsaea, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Bromeliaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with long, narrow leaves that often form a dense carpet on the forest floor. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale green flowers. It is typically found in shaded, moist environments in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of understory vegetation in humid forests.
